It is characterized by its delicate, creeping rhizomes and its ability to form dense mats on rocky or shaded forest floors. The fronds are typically bipinnate, with a slender and arching appearance, and they often have a light green to pale yellowish color. This plant thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Diplazium acrotis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
